title: Memoir of James Wyld of Gilston, and his family
snippet: Mr Stodart occasionally took summer quarters in the neighbourhood  of Edinburgh, for the sake of variety to himself and his family. I remember a visit of some duration paid to him at Limefield, near West Calder, in 18 19, and well I may remember it. My father drove my mother there from Bonnington Bank in his gig, and I, who had only returned from Fulnec a few days before, and had thus but a very brief opportunity of practising horsemanship , was destined to accompany them on a small Shetland pony, and thus make proof of my skill in a new art.
